blog.title: THE KING OF TIELAND
blog.description: Mr. Merenda is a high school science teacher bringing you Fun Facts from comics, movies, TV, video games, and more every weekday!  He also boasts an impressive collection of over 500 TIES, which along with his many collectibles, are on display for you right here!

summary: One of my favorite satisfying and funny parts in Spider-Man:Into The Spider Verse. I loved how they took on the Spider-Man...
body: One of my favorite satisfying and funny parts in Spider-Man:Into The Spider Verse. I loved how they took on the Spider-Man pointing at Spider-Man Meme with Future Spidey taking the other Spider-Man’s place. They also even recreated the cheap,low-budget animation of the original 60’s cartoon and Stan Lee got his wish to play J.Jonah Jamaeson In this post -credits scene

reblog.comment: One of my favorite satisfying and funny parts in Spider-Man:Into The Spider Verse. “One last spin”

30x40cm (11,8x15,75 inches), printed on 250g Rives Tradition paper.

Limited edition of 30.

50 euros + shipping.

Prints are numbered and hand-signed.

Contact me by email at rajoelina.a@gmail.com for purchase.

blog.name: bujutsu
blog.title: Designer's Bujutsu
blog.description:
My name is Gene Crawford, welcome to my training journal.

Blackbelt in Shotokan Karate
Fitness/Performance Coach
CrossFit, SealFit
Spartan Trifecta 2016

I follow this philosophy of what "total fitness" means:
Physical Control
Mental Toughness
Emotional Resiliency
Awareness & Intuition
Kokoro (Grit)

Download my FOCUS one sheet PDF that I use to find my center and push through tough situations in life: Focus Poster PDF

title: Workhorse: Training
body:

20:00 AMRAP
6x Toes To Bar

6x Burpee Broad Jumps

6x Wall Balls 20#
[5+2]

summary: Anything You Can Do, I Can Do Better (Peter B. Parker x Reader)
body:
Anything You Can Do, I Can Do Better (Peter B. Parker x Reader)

Word count: 1.3k

Warnings: fluff fluff fluff, language (once)

———————————————————————

Baking was always a favourite pastime of yours. Whether or not it was a success was another story, but you’d like to think even the failed ones were successful. If you were trying to bake a cake and it didn’t work out, it became a pudding instead. I mean, it still tasted great so hardly a failure in your eyes. Baking with Peter however was another story.

“What are you up to now, hmm?” Peter walked into the kitchen in nothing but his grey sweatpants, looking questionably at what you were doing. Questionably because you were trying to figure out your own measurements without weighing scales, and in doing so had created a mess all over the kitchen counter and over yourself. Huffing, you crossed your arms and pouted towards Peter.

“What kind of madman doesn’t own weighing scales or even measuring cups?!” You exclaimed, furrowing your brows in frustration as Peter merely walked towards you and gave a small chuckle. “Well, Y/N, usually the kind of ‘madman’ that lives solely off of takeout pizza” Peter says, giving you a lopsided grin whilst nodding towards the empty pizza boxes that had piled up near the bin. Sighing, you simply walked into him, smothering the side of your face against his chest as you whined in a strange attempt to make yourself feel better. Wrapping his arms around you, he said “hey, it’s okay. We’ll figure it out together. What do we need to measure and how much of it?” Looking up at him with a pout, you told him the exact measurements of everything that you needed, and together you both tried your best to eye the measurements. Like you said before, a failed cake will become pudding instead.

When it came to measuring the flour, you knew you had to be cautious here, especially around Peter B. Parker. Peter mixed with flour was a recipe for disaster. That man had played too many tricks on you for you to trust him around the damn flour, but apparently you couldn’t act quick enough in preventing the problematic situation of a mushroom cloud of flour filling the kitchen. “Peter don’t you dare - PETER BENJAMIN PARKER IF YOU—” before you could even finish your sentence, Peter grabbed the pack of flour, sticking his hand inside and throwing it at you. The flour covered the whole of your face and almost all of your torso, making you look as if you walked through a snow storm. Peter doubled over in laughter, wheezing hard from how funny he found it. But you knew better. You wanted to make sure that messing with Y/F/N Y/L/N was a declaration of war itself, and you weren’t going down without a fight. Seeing his fit of laughter as a window of opportunity, you quickly grabbed the pack of flour and moved it behind you, slowly making your way towards Peter. “Peter, that’s not fu—” you were off by an abrupt sneeze leaving you from the obvious flour entering your nose. Peter stood upright as he wiped his eyes from the tears that had started to form from his laughter, looking you in the eyes with his own big, chocolate ones.

“Y/N, you never learn. How many times has this happened before? Like, 5? I don’t know, I lost count” Peter smirked at you, using his obvious towering height as an advantage and as a means of intimidating you. Bringing one hand up to his neck in order to bring him closer so you could whisper into his ear, you said “oh Peter, when will you ever learn that anything you can do, I can do better” using this moment to your advantage, you quickly moved back and grabbed the flour, launching the whole thing at Peter’s ‘oh shit’ face. Now it was your turn to double over in laughter and be on the brink of tears while Peter coughed up clouds of flour, shaking his head in an attempt to get the flour out of his hair and face. Coming down from the high of laughter, you held on to the side of the counter to support your body. “You are evil, Y/N, pure evil” Peter pouted towards you as he crossed his arms and hunched his shoulders. You wiped his face with your hands, staring into his eyes once more and feeling the love radiating off of him. Now, standing there covered in flour, in an attempt to lighten him up, you pressed a small kiss to the corner of his lips, and then kissed him all over his face. You could see how hard he was trying to keep the pout up, but the quivering of his lips and eyebrows gave him up.

Stepping back, you both looked around at the surrounding area, finding everything covered top to bottom by flour, “look at what a mess we’ve made”. Looking at you with one brow raised, he said “a mess ‘we’ve made’? Excuse you, this-“ Peter pointed all around him as he continued, “-was all you”. Scoffing, you fired back, “none of this would’ve happened if you didn’t throw flour at me so now you face the consequences of messing with the mighty Y/N”.

“Now you can’t bake whatever it is you were going to bake and whatever I was going to eat” Peter retaliated. You, being two steps ahead of the game, walked towards one of the kitchen cupboards and pulled out a new pack of flour. The plan was to make brownies and nothing was going to get in your way of that, not even a flour storm. “Huh, I should’ve guessed that you of all people would be prepared for this. What’re you planning on baking anyway?” You made sure Peter kept his distance during the second flour process and replied “brownies, not just any brownies, my brownies” winking towards Peter as you finished the sentence. If heart eyes were real, you were sure that Peter’s eyes would have them right now. “Now, if you’re up for it, how about we try and make these together, hmm?”

Peter immediately stood by your side as you began the process of making your infamous brownies. You let Peter use the electric whisk to combine all the sugar and eggs and butter, and made sure you kept him away from any of the dry ingredients, particularly the flour and more importantly, the cocoa powder. Together, you two were a pretty good team, minus the flour fight. “You’re doing such a great job, Pete. At this rate, we could open our own bakery” you joked as Peter shot you a look of disbelief. “Oh my god, Y/N. Now you’re just purposely bringing back flashbacks of my failed TGI Spideys”.

Chuckling, you folded in the dry ingredients along with the chocolate pieces and popped the mixture into a pan and then into the oven. “Can I lick the bowl Y/N? Pretty please?” Peter shot you his puppy eyes and who could say no to those gorgeous eyes? “Of course. You helped in making the mixture so it’s only fair, Pete. But can I have the spoon?”. Peter nodded quickly and watching his eyes light up, Peter quickly delved into the remnants of the brownie mixture left in the bowl whilst you got to lick the spoon.

“Have I told you how much I love you, Y/N? Because I really, reeeeeaaaaally love you” Peter looked at you with his charming smile, brownie mixture tainting the side of his mouth. Reaching out, you wiped the side of his mouth to rid him of the chocolate and gave him a kiss. A kiss that spoke a thousand words. He knew that you loved him, that you love him even now. Parting your lips from his, you gazed into his eyes and held him close. You love this man, more than words could describe. You wished you could give him all the stars in the sky because he deserved nothing less. This tired man brought nothing but life to you and he filled you with love every single day.

“I love you, Peter B. Parker”

But you knew better. You wanted to make sure that messing with Y/F/N Y/L/N was a declaration of war itself, and you weren’t going down without a fight. Seeing his fit of laughter as a window of opportunity, you quickly grabbed the pack of flour and moved it behind you, slowly making your way towards Peter. “Peter, that’s not fu—” you were off by an abrupt sneeze leaving you from the obvious flour entering your nose. Peter stood upright as he wiped his eyes from the tears that had started to form from his laughter, looking you in the eyes with his own big, chocolate ones.

“Y/N, you never learn. How many times has this happened before? Like, 5? I don’t know, I lost count” Peter smirked at you, using his obvious towering height as an advantage and as a means of intimidating you. Bringing one hand up to his neck in order to bring him closer so you could whisper into his ear, you said “oh Peter, when will you ever learn that anything you can do, I can do better” using this moment to your advantage, you quickly moved back and grabbed the flour, launching the whole thing at Peter’s ‘oh shit’ face. Now it was your turn to double over in laughter and be on the brink of tears while Peter coughed up clouds of flour, shaking his head in an attempt to get the flour out of his hair and face. Coming down from the high of laughter, you held on to the side of the counter to support your body. “You are evil, Y/N, pure evil” Peter pouted towards you as he crossed his arms and hunched his shoulders. You wiped his face with your hands, staring into his eyes once more and feeling the love radiating off of him. Now, standing there covered in flour, in an attempt to lighten him up, you pressed a small kiss to the corner of his lips, and then kissed him all over his face. You could see how hard he was trying to keep the pout up, but the quivering of his lips and eyebrows gave him up.

Stepping back, you both looked around at the surrounding area, finding everything covered top to bottom by flour, “look at what a mess we’ve made”. Looking at you with one brow raised, he said “a mess ‘we’ve made’? Excuse you, this-“ Peter pointed all around him as he continued, “-was all you”. Scoffing, you fired back, “none of this would’ve happened if you didn’t throw flour at me so now you face the consequences of messing with the mighty Y/N”.

“Now you can’t bake whatever it is you were going to bake and whatever I was going to eat” Peter retaliated. You, being two steps ahead of the game, walked towards one of the kitchen cupboards and pulled out a new pack of flour. The plan was to make brownies and nothing was going to get in your way of that, not even a flour storm. “Huh, I should’ve guessed that you of all people would be prepared for this. What’re you planning on baking anyway?” You made sure Peter kept his distance during the second flour process and replied “brownies, not just any brownies, my brownies” winking towards Peter as you finished the sentence. If heart eyes were real, you were sure that Peter’s eyes would have them right now. “Now, if you’re up for it, how about we try and make these together, hmm?”

Peter immediately stood by your side as you began the process of making your infamous brownies. You let Peter use the electric whisk to combine all the sugar and eggs and butter, and made sure you kept him away from any of the dry ingredients, particularly the flour and more importantly, the cocoa powder. Together, you two were a pretty good team, minus the flour fight. “You’re doing such a great job, Pete. At this rate, we could open our own bakery” you joked as Peter shot you a look of disbelief. “Oh my god, Y/N. Now you’re just purposely bringing back flashbacks of my failed TGI Spideys”.

Chuckling, you folded in the dry ingredients along with the chocolate pieces and popped the mixture into a pan and then into the oven. “Can I lick the bowl Y/N? Pretty please?” Peter shot you his puppy eyes and who could say no to those gorgeous eyes? “Of course. You helped in making the mixture so it’s only fair, Pete. But can I have the spoon?”. Peter nodded quickly and watching his eyes light up, Peter quickly delved into the remnants of the brownie mixture left in the bowl whilst you got to lick the spoon.

“Have I told you how much I love you, Y/N? Because I really, reeeeeaaaaally love you” Peter looked at you with his charming smile, brownie mixture tainting the side of his mouth. Reaching out, you wiped the side of his mouth to rid him of the chocolate and gave him a kiss. A kiss that spoke a thousand words. He knew that you loved him, that you love him even now. Parting your lips from his, you gazed into his eyes and held him close. You love this man, more than words could describe. You wished you could give him all the stars in the sky because he deserved nothing less. This tired man brought nothing but life to you and he filled you with love every single day.

“I love you, Peter B. Parker”

summary:
Chapter One of my new Norman x Otto fic is up! 💚✨ Yes, yes I am obsessed with this ship.
Please give this one a read because...
body:
Date Night - Chapter 1 - greengreed - Spider-Man - All Media Types [Archive of Our Own]


Chapter One of my new Norman x Otto fic is up! 💚✨ Yes, yes I am obsessed with this ship.

Please give this one a read because this one has been really fun to write for me. ❤️ Also, in the future, there will be cameos from other fun Marvel characters… You’ll have to read to see who! 💕

Summary:

Otto and Norman have a gala to go to one night, though Otto hates big parties. Still, he ends up going. Will he be able to make something of the night? Norman will make sure he has at least a little fun, maybe in a way Otto didn’t expect. Nonetheless, Norman plans to make the night completely unforgettable.

summary: Peter opened his eyes.  Everything was a blinding white and his head throbbed painfully.  “Pete?” a familiar voice asked.  Peter...
body:
Peter opened his eyes.  Everything was a blinding white and his head throbbed painfully.  “Pete?” a familiar voice asked.

Peter couldn’t seem to form words as he sat up and saw who the voice had come from.  He could barely believe his eyes, after all, he’d seen this man get impaled protecting Cap only last year, but it was definately him.  Tony Stark.

“M-Mr. Stark?” Peter asked, getting up.  He wanted to cry.  All this time, he’d thought Tony had been dead, but no.  He’d been here on Hala.  Peter was sure he’d had good reason, maybe that’s why Carol brought them here, to save him, but there wasn’t time to think about that.

“Yeah, it’s me,” Mr. Stark said, spreading his arms as if to let Peter take it all in, a ghost of a smile on his mouth, “I wasn’t gonna let the big Purple Giant get the better of me just because he had a fancy glove and a rock collection.”

Peter stepped forward, intending to give Tony a hug when he felt a hand on his shoulder.  Looking up, he saw Carol.  “CAN YOU BELIEVE IT?  HE’S ALIVE!”

Carol, however, looked sadly, mabye even a bit angirly at Tony.  “Really?”

Now Peter was just confused.  “No, it’s Mr. Stark.  He’s cool, trust me.”

Carol just shook her head.  “It’s not him Peter.  Let’s go.”

“But I don’t wanna go.”  Immeditely upon saying this, Peter’s body seized up and he slammed his eyes shut.  He grabbed his shoulder as if to reassure himself it was still there.

“Hey, hey, Pete, it’s ok.  It’s ok,” Mr. Stark consoled, placing a hand on his arm, but Carol shot Tony back with a photon blast.

“It’s not him Peter.  It’s just a computer, look.”  Peter opened his eyes slightly and saw that Tony had merely gotten up and dusted his suit off.  Carol was right.  A human wouldn’t have survived that.

A moment later, Peter opened his eyes.  Snakelike wires were detachting from his skin.  Carol was at his side, with three Kree guards unconsious beside her.

Peter swallowed back tears and stood.  “We have a mission to complete.”
